course_description: Individual instrumental or vocal tutorial. Advanced technical and interpretive training as well as recital preparation.
instructor: Dean, Kevin; Ducharme, Jérôme; Dahlen, Sienna (Fall) Hauser, Rudolf-Alexius; Roy, Andre J; Poletaev, Ilya; Leclair, Jacqueline; Pilc, Jean-Michel; Stoelzel, Richard; Vallée, Jean-Sébastien; Bandy, Dorian; Bergeron, sylvain; Napper, Susan; Ducharme, Jérôme; Basque, Alexis; Brault, Olivier; Wan, Andrew; Hollenbeck, John (Winter)

title: MUIN 734 D.Mus. Performance Tutorial 12
course_description: Individual instrumental or vocal tutorial. Advanced technical and interpretive training as well as recital preparation.
instructor: Haimovitz, Matt; Napper, Susan; Hauser, Rudolf-Alexius; Léonard, Mélanie (Fall) Hauser, Rudolf-Alexius (Winter)

title: MUIT 201 String Techniques
course_description: The fundamental techniques in performance of four common stringed instruments, i.e., violin, viola, cello, and bass. Principles of sound production on stringed instruments, historical development of the strings, purchase of new and used instruments, maintenance and repairs, teaching procedures and reference materials.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUIT 202 Woodwind Techniques
course_description: The fundamental techniques in performance of five common woodwind instruments, i.e., clarinet, flute, oboe, bassoon, and saxophone. Principles of sound production, historical development of the woodwinds, purchase of new and used instruments, maintenance and repairs, teaching procedures and reference materials.
instructor: Bell, Jennifer E; Dagenais, Jonathan (Fall)

title: MUIT 203 Brass Techniques
course_description: The fundamental techniques in performance of five common brass instruments, i.e., trumpet, horn, trombone, baritone, and tuba. Principles of sound production, historical development of the brass, purchase of new and used instruments, maintenance and repairs, teaching procedures and reference materials.
instructor: Dix, Trevor; Dagenais, Jonathan (Fall)

title: MUIT 204 Percussion Techniques
course_description: The fundamental techniques in performance of percussion instruments commonly in use in symphonic bands and orchestras. Principles of sound production, historical development of the percussion, purchase of new and used instruments, maintenance and repairs, teaching procedures and reference materials.
instructor: Mativetsky, Shawn; Dagenais, Jonathan (Fall)

title: MUIT 250 Guitar Techniques
course_description: The fundamental techniques in guitar performance. Basic principles of beginning and intermediate pedagogy, sound production, historical development of the instrument, purchase of new and used instruments, maintenance and repair, and teaching materials and repertoire for solo and ensemble performance.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUIT 302 Advanced Wind Techniques
course_description: Continued exploration of brass and woodwind pedagogy. Methods for developing technique and musical sensitivity in beginning and intermediate performers will be explored through in-depth study of heterogeneous and homogeneous instrumental methods. Skill on secondary instruments and diagnostic and prescriptive teaching abilities will be extended through Lab performances and individual coaching projects.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUIT 315 Instrumental Conducting
course_description: The fundamental skills of instrumental conducting, including baton technique, score analysis, and rehearsal procedures; conducting materials are selected from representative orchestral works.
instructor: Dagenais, Jonathan (Fall)

title: MUJZ 160 Jazz Materials 1
course_description: Fundamental aural and theoretical skills associated with the jazz idiom. Nomenclature, chord construction, chord/scale relationships, harmonic progression, circle of 5ths, simple turnarounds, simple substitution, symmetrical scales and chord relationships, voice leading.
instructor: Walkington, Alec (Fall)

title: MUJZ 161 Jazz Materials 2
course_description: Simple and advanced substitution, borrowed chords, reharmonisation, modes of harmonic minor and melodic minor diatonic systems, unresolved tensions, odd and infrequent modulations, mixed two-five-ones, introduction to polychords, slashchords and non-functional harmony.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUJZ 170 Jazz Keyboard Proficiency 1
course_description: Basic piano skills, basic comping techniques, standard 3 note rootless voicings in 7, 3 and 3, 7 position with one extension, two-five-ones in major and minor - limited keys. Simple substitution and reharmonisation.
instructor: Suh, Min Jung (Fall)

title: MUJZ 171 Jazz Keyboard Proficiency 2
course_description: Continuation of previous semester. Two-five-ones and mixed two-five-ones using 4 note close position voicings and 4 and 5 note spreads, in all keys, diminished passing chords, half step shifts, voice leading extensions, quartal and modal voicing, sight reading of standard jazz repertoire.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUJZ 172 Drum Set Proficiency
course_description: Basic drums skills and techniques, initiation to main rhythms and grooves (swing, straight 8s, Latin, Afro-Cuban etc). Practice of claves, independence & simple polyrhythms. Usual meters (3/4, 4/4, 6/8) and most common odd meters (5/4, 7/4). Tempo, time and placement.
instructor: Lacombe, Valerie (Fall)

title: MUJZ 187 Jazz History Survey
course_description: An introductory study of the principal recordings, artists and musical trends in jazz from its origins to the present day.
instructor: White, Andre (Fall)

title: MUJZ 213 Fundamentals of Jazz Improvisation 1
course_description: Introduction to basic improvisation concepts of phrasing, articulation, melodic development, harmonic control, musical vocabulary and style. Pedagogical techniques will be discussed.
instructor: Sweenie, John (Fall)

title: MUJZ 214 Fundamentals of Jazz Improvisation 2
course_description: A continuation of development of basic improvisation concepts of phrasing, articulation, melodic development, harmonic control, musical vocabulary and style. Pedagogical techniques will be discussed.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUJZ 223 Jazz Improvisation/Musicianship 1
course_description: Basic improvisational concepts with emphasis on time feel, phrasing, articulation, melodic development, voice leading, harmonic control and stylistic nuance. Memorization and aural recognition of standard jazz repertoire also stressed. The aural tradition of the music is emphasized through rhythmic/melodic dictation.
instructor: White, Andre; Pilc, Jean-Michel (Fall)

title: MUJZ 224 Jazz Improvisation/Musicianship 2
course_description: Continuation of Jazz Improvisation/Musicianship MUJZ 223.
instructor: Pilc, Jean-Michel (Winter)

title: MUJZ 225 Jazz Vocal Improvisation 1
course_description: Fundamental concepts of the blues, blues expression, blues function and its application to vocal improvisation in jazz. The history of the blues and the cultural influence of Black American music on popular American music and jazz will be analyzed. Emphasis on ear training, performance, memorization and transcription of required jazz solos.
instructor: Thurman-Green, Camille (Fall)

title: MUJZ 226 Jazz Vocal Improvisation 2
course_description: Fundamental concepts of the blues, blues expression, storytelling, blues function and its application to jazz vocal improvisation and standard jazz repertoire. Advanced blues harmonic structures and forms will be analyzed. Emphasis on ear training, performance, applied musicianship, memorization and transcription of required jazz solos.
instructor: Thurman-Green, Camille (Winter)

title: MUJZ 260 Jazz Arranging 1
course_description: Introduction to concepts and techniques commonly used in jazz arranging. Notation, calligraphy and score preparation are discussed; including study of classical and contemporary scores by prominent jazz arrangers.
instructor: Deschamps, Benjamin; Donaldson, Taylor; Sullivan, Joseph Leo (Fall)

title: MUJZ 261 Jazz Arranging 2
course_description: Consolidation of knowledge of basic concepts and techniques used in jazz arranging.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUJZ 262 Applied Jazz Theory
course_description: An examination of harmonic practices and compositional styles in post-1960 jazz. Various theoretical approaches to jazz harmonic analysis will be addressed. Students analyze and compose jazz tunes and longer forms.
instructor: Lindhorst, Jonathan (Fall)

title: MUJZ 323 Advanced Jazz Ear Training
course_description: Dictation workshop. Content includes tonal functions commonly found in Blues, Standard Tunes and post-1960s tunes; all harmonic structures commonly used in jazz; modulations to all keys; harmonic sequences and turnaround patterns; all commonly used jazz scales; melodic dictation of tonic, II-V and turnaround patterns.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUJZ 325 Jazz Vocal Improvisation 3
course_description: Fundamental concepts of jazz vocal improvisation and its use and application in standard jazz repertoire, with an emphasis on ear training, performance, harmonic analysis, language development and applied musicianship. American songbook repertoire will be the focus.
instructor: Lee, Ranee Y (Fall)

title: MUJZ 326 Jazz Vocal Improvisation 4
course_description: Fundamental concepts of jazz vocal improvisation and its use and application in standard jazz repertoire, with an emphasis on ear training, performance, harmonic analysis, language development and applied musicianship. Classic and contemporary jazz standard repertoire will be the focus.
instructor: Lee, Ranee Y (Winter)

title: MUJZ 341 Jazz Composition 2
course_description: A continuation of development of a personal and creative jazz compositional style.
instructor: Dean, Kevin (Winter)

title: MUJZ 423 Jazz Improvisation/Musicianship 3
course_description: Refinement of improvisational concepts in conjunction with ear training, leading towards the establishment of a personal style of playing. Complex forms and harmonies, and contemporary techniques. Memorization of large and varied repertoire is stressed. The ability to identify, transcribe and perform various melodies, rhythms, and complex harmonies by ear will be stressed.
instructor: Bolduc, Remi; Coleman, Ira (Fall)

title: MUJZ 424 Jazz Improvisation/Musicianship 4
course_description: Continuation of Jazz Improvisation/Musicianship MUJZ 423.
instructor: Bolduc, Remi; Coleman, Ira (Winter)

title: MUJZ 425 Jazz Vocal Repertoire 1
course_description: Fundamental concepts of applied performance technique, arranging for vocalists, accompaniment skills and repertoire development with an emphasis on improvisation and performance. Analysis of selected recordings and concert performance videos.
instructor: Thurman-Green, Camille; Green, Darrell (Fall)

title: MUJZ 426 Jazz Vocal Repertoire 2
course_description: Fundamental concepts of applied performance technique, arranging for vocalists, accompaniment skills and repertoire development with an emphasis on improvisation and performance. Analysis of selected recordings and concert performance videos.
instructor: Thurman-Green, Camille; Green, Darrell (Winter)

title: MUJZ 440 Advanced Jazz Composition 1
course_description: A continuation of MUJZ 341. This course will reaffirm the importance of the basic elements of composition with an emphasis on the compositional process and micro-listening.
instructor: Dean, Kevin (Fall)

title: MUJZ 441 Advanced Jazz Composition 2
course_description:
A continuation of MUJZ 440. This course will further emphasize and facilitate the development of a personal and creative compositional style. Jazz aesthetics will be
emphasized and explored in greater depth.
instructor: Hollenbeck, John (Winter)

title: MUJZ 461D1 Advanced Jazz Arranging
course_description: This course introduces advanced concepts in jazz writing by examining scores by historically-important jazz composers/arrangers, as well as contemporary masters. Student writing, including expanded combo, big band, and small group string projects, is geared toward public performance by McGill jazz ensembles and combos.
instructor: Sullivan, Joseph Leo (Fall)

title: MUJZ 461D2 Advanced Jazz Arranging
course_description: See MUJZ 461D1 for course description.
instructor: Sullivan, Joseph Leo (Winter)

title: MUJZ 493 Jazz Performance Practice
course_description: An in-depth exploration of the performance practice of leading jazz figures, primarily through the study of solo transcriptions. Comparative study of conceptual differences in time feel, ornamentation, tone quality, articulation and harmonic and melodic approach. Detailed study of major rhythm sections and their interaction with soloists.
instructor: Dean, Kevin (Winter)

title: MUJZ 601 Jazz Pedagogy
course_description: A course designed to prepare students to teach jazz-related subjects at the university and professional level, with emphasis on ensemble direction and the instruction of improvisation, as well as course and curriculum development. Various pedagogical methods, philosophies, rehearsal techniques, and materials will be investigated.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUJZ 640 Jazz Composition and Arranging 1
course_description: Analysis and application of a variety of jazz and 20th Century compositional and arranging techniques, including writing for small and medium size jazz ensembles.
instructor: Sullivan, Joseph Leo (Fall)

title: MUJZ 641 Jazz Composition and Arranging 2
course_description: Students compose and arrange for a variety of instrumental combinations including large jazz ensembles of ten or more instruments.
instructor: Sullivan, Joseph Leo (Winter)

title: MUJZ 644 Jazz Repertoire Project 1
course_description: Students investigate an approved area of jazz orchestral repertoire, under the supervision of a full-time faculty member.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUJZ 645 Jazz Repertoire Project 2
course_description: Jazz repertoire for any ensemble format may be explored.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUMT 202 Fundamentals of New Media
course_description: A theoretical and practical introduction to selected areas of music technology. Topics include digital audio and sampling theory, MIDI and sequencing, audio editing and mixing, elementary sound recording, score editing software and current areas of research interest.
instructor: Acquilino, Alberto; West, Travis (Fall)

title: MUMT 203 Introduction to Digital Audio
course_description: An introduction to digital audio and the technologies involved in its practical realization and use in computer music. Topics will include audio signals and systems, sampling & quantization, signal encoding, compression, transmission and storage, filters, analog-to-digital and digital-to-analog converters, digital audio effects, sound sampling and synthesis techniques.
instructor: Wanderley, Marcelo (Fall)

title: MUMT 250 Music Perception and Cognition
course_description: Basic processes by which the brain transforms sound waves into musical events, dimensions, systems and structures and the processes by which musicians imagine new musical sounds and structures and plan movements that produce music on instruments.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUMT 301 Music and the Internet
course_description: A brief history of Internet technologies (protocols, web servers, web browsers) and their relationship to music and musicians (physical vs. virtual music distribution, digital music formats, streaming services). Locating, retrieving, and working with online music information through Web APIs and coding exercises. Basic static website creation for musicians (HTML/CSS/JavaScript). Technology-enhanced music creation.
instructor: Fradkin, Meesh; Puranik, Ninad (Fall)

title: MUMT 302 New Media Production 1
course_description: Techniques for producing and manipulating music and sound for new media applications. Synthesis techniques including FM, granular and physical modeling. Audio effects including delay, reverberation, dynamics processing, and filtering. Audio compression, HCI and MIR concepts.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUMT 303 New Media Production 2
course_description: Advanced audio processing with general considerations of aesthetics in sonic art. Introduction to theory and practice of digital video processing using Jitter.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUMT 306 Music and Audio Computing 1
course_description: Concepts, algorithms, data structures, and programming techniques for the development of music and audio software, ranging from musical instrument design to interactive music performance systems.
instructor: Maestre Gomez, Esteban (Fall)

title: MUMT 307 Music and Audio Computing 2
course_description: Theory and implementation of signal processing techniques for sound synthesis and audio effects processing using Matlab, C++, and Max/MSP.
instructor: Scavone, Gary (Winter)

title: MUMT 501 Digital Audio Signal Processing
course_description:
Discrete-time signal processing concepts and techniques. Discrete-time fourier transform and series, linear time-invariant systems, digital filtering, spectral
analysis of discrete-time signals, and the z-transform.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUMT 502 Senior Project: Music Technology
course_description: Independent senior project in Music Technology. Students will design and implement a medium-scale project in consultation with their advisor. Evaluation will be based on concept, background research, implementation, reliability, and documentation.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUMT 605 Digital Sound Synthesis and Audio Process
course_description: Basic principles of digital sound synthesis including techniques such as additive synthesis, frequency modulation, tuned resonators, waveshaping and digital audio processing techniques including simple delay systems, filters, reverberators, spatial controllers, etc. will be explored.
instructor: Depalle, Philippe (Fall)

title: MUMT 609 Music, Media and Technology Project
course_description: Independent music technology project. Students will prepare a statement of objectives, a comprehensive project design and a schedule of work, and will undertake the project on appropriate music technology platforms.
instructor: Depalle, Philippe (Fall)

title: MUMT 610 Music Technology Seminar 1
course_description: Advanced topics in computer applications in music will be examined. Students will be expected to 1) present critical analyses of current research and 2) develop and implement software demonstrations.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUMT 611 Music Technology Seminar 2
course_description: Advanced topics in computer applications in music will be examined. Students will be expected to 1) present critical analyses of current research and 2) develop and implement software demonstrations.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUMT 615 Music Technology Seminar 6
course_description: Advanced topics in computer applications in music will be examined. Students will be expected to 1) present critical analyses of current research and 2) develop and implement software demonstrations.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUMT 616 Timbre Form-Bearing Dimension in Music
course_description: Music theoretic, performance-related, psychophysical, and cognitive perspectives on musical timbre and its role as a bearer of musical form from small-scale patterns to large-scale structures.
instructor: Duinker, Ben; Gutierrez Martinez, Andres (Fall)

title: MUMT 617 Cognitive Dynamics of Music Listening
course_description: Music theoretic, performance-related, psychophysical and cognitive approaches to the temporal dynamics of musical listening to, and experience of, contemporary musical materials and form.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUMT 618 Computational Modeling of Musical Acoustics
course_description: Methods for discrete-time modeling of musical acoustic systems, with an emphasis on digital waveguide techniques.  Delay-based audio effects, artificial reverberation, musical instrument models and "physically-informed" approaches to sound synthesis.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUMT 619 Input Devices for Musical Expression
course_description: Basic technologies used in the design of input devices for musical expression, including the most common types of electronic sensors, actuators and associated conditioning circuits with examples of their application to gestural controllers.
instructor: Wanderley, Marcelo (Winter)

title: MUMT 620 Gestural Control of Sound Synthesis
course_description: Use of computers as part of novel digital musical instruments, including physical gestures and actions, the design and evaluation of new interfaces for musical expression, and mapping strategies between gestures and sounds.
instructor: Wanderley, Marcelo (Fall)

title: MUMT 621 Music Information, Retrieval, Acquisition, Preservation
course_description: Interdisciplinary applications for storing, preserving and retrieving musical information in musicology, music education, music theory, psychology, engineering, and library and information science based on musical similarity, genre classification, timbre recognition, automatic transcription, music representation, and formal analysis.
instructor: Fujinaga, Ichiro (Winter)

title: MUMT 622 Time-Frequency and Parametric Representations of Sounds
course_description: Research trends in time-frequency representations and parametric modeling in the context of music and audio applications. Specific focus on the analysis of sounds using parametric methods.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUPD 200 Introduction to Music Marketing
course_description: Business models for monetizing music effectively in the digital era; music marketing fundamentals; music value chain; traditional and new marketing tools; publicity, advertising and promotion; the e-press kit; touring and merchandising; online distribution; social network marketing strategies; rebirth of video content; viral marketing; marketing for subscriptions, wireless; global perspectives.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUPD 204 Production for Digital Media 1
course_description: Fundamental video production techniques for music and general applications. Professional video camera operation, lighting and shooting techniques. The lab component of the course includes camera setup and operation during Schulich School of Music productions for live internet streaming. Capture and editing of video, audio, text and graphics for use in creating digital media. Basic techniques of recording audio for video.
instructor: Castillo, John (Fall)

title: MUPD 235 Music as a Profession 2
course_description: An overview of the responsibilities and skills required of professions in music and of the varied career paths leading from a music degree.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUPD 350 Applied Projects for Musicians
course_description: Project-based course aimed at providing students with the skills required in the evolving music business, through analysis of case studies and developing projects focused around music entrepreneurship. Teams of three or four students will plan and implement a creative, collaborative project, synthesizing and putting into practice business and entrepreneurial skills. They will develop a pitch for their project, present their project, and write it up in a final paper. Students will also be required to write a reflection paper on process, teamwork, skill development, and outcomes.
instructor: Gaudry, Danielle (Winter)

title: MUPD 473 Special Project: Professional Development 1
course_description: Special project in professional development.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUPD 474 Special Project: Professional Development 2
course_description: Special project in professional development.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUPD 475 Special Project: Professional Development 3
course_description: Special project in professional development.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUPD 499 Internship: Music Professional Development
course_description: Music internship in professional development with an approved host institution or organization.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUPD 560 Music Information and Research Skills
course_description: Introduction to music information and research skills, including navigation of music information systems and tools, finding and evaluating online and physical resources, and documenting research through appropriate citations; introduction to writing performance-related content (e.g., program/liner notes, grant proposals).
instructor: Nachtergaele, Shanti; Gagnon-Legault, Maryse; van Vliet, Kiersten (Fall)

title: MUPD 580 Piano Pedagogy Practicum
course_description: Observation of studio and master class teaching, videotaped private instruction, and adjudication of student performances.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUPD 650 Research Methods in Music
course_description:
This interdisciplinary lecture offers an overview of the fundamental principles of research in music. Emphasis is placed on acquainting students with the methods and techniques most commonly used to study music and musical processes. Topics include approaches and theories, artistic research, research project design,
procedures for carrying out research, as well as both qualitatively- and quantitatively-oriented methods of data collection, processing and analysis.
instructor: Aldrich, Simon (Fall)

title: MUPG 209 Introduction to Lyric Diction
course_description: Rules of lyric diction and the sounds of the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA).
instructor: Burmeister Strauss, Anja (Fall)

title: MUPG 210 Italian Diction
course_description: Study of International Phonetic Alphabet. Study of Italian pronunciation in singing using song and opera texts.
instructor: Popescu, Annamaria; Oppedisano, Cosimo (Fall)

title: MUPG 211 French Diction
course_description: Study of French pronunciation in singing using song and opera texts.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUPG 212 English Diction
course_description: Study of International Phonetic Alphabet. Study of Standard English pronunciation in singing using song and opera texts with a special emphasis on problematic vowels, diphthongs and consonants.
instructor: Koch, Elizabeth (Fall)

title: MUPG 213 German Diction
course_description: Study of German pronunciation in singing using song and opera texts.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUPG 229 Traditional Drumming 1: Rudiments
course_description: Rudiments based on the French, Swiss, American and British styles.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUPG 272D1 Continuo
course_description: An historically-oriented study of the principles of figured-bass. The student will realize at sight elementary bass patterns. Standard idioms from historical treatises will be introduced.
instructor: Miller, Elizaveta (Fall)

title: MUPG 272D2 Continuo
course_description: See MUPG 272D1 for course description.
instructor: Miller, Elizaveta (Winter)

title: MUPG 296 Acting for Voice
course_description: Acting methods focused on improvisation, open scenes, and script analysis, including Laban theory and character development based on environments, relationships, objectives, obstacles, tactics and stakes.
instructor: Patterson, Jonathan (Fall)

title: MUPG 297 Movement for Voice
course_description: Critical awareness of the body in space, interpersonal and intrapersonal knowledge of one's own spine, torso, and extremities and their function in movement as well as stillness. Methods may include Feldenkreis, period dance, Tai Chi and/or Alexander Technique.
instructor: Patterson, Jonathan (Fall)

title: MUPG 309 Advanced Diction
course_description: Advanced lyric diction.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUPG 315D1 Introduction to Orchestral Conducting
course_description: Emphasis on classical repertoire (Haydn, Mozart, Beethoven). Practical analysis and score preparation, style, and interpretation. Development of clear and expressive technique. Some practical experience.
instructor: Hauser, Rudolf-Alexius; Gaudry, Danielle (Fall)

title: MUPG 315D2 Introduction to Orchestral Conducting
course_description: See MUPG 315D1 for course description.
instructor: Hauser, Rudolf-Alexius; Gaudry, Danielle (Winter)

title: MUPG 316D1 Introduction to Choral Conducting
course_description: Group conducting tutorial. Technical and interpretive development and preparation of the conducting minor project.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUPG 316D2 Introduction to Choral Conducting
course_description: See MUPG 316D1 for description.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUPG 325 Improvisation for String Players
course_description: Improvisation from its use in the early baroque to present day repertoire.

title: MUPG 691 Vocal Ornamentation
course_description: Introduction to the major treatises with emphasis on their practical application to modern performance. Through the study and discussion of both primary and secondary sources, students will observe and compare national styles. Special topics include the conventions of recitative; text-driven embellishment; ornamentation in Handel's dramatic works.
instructor: Smith Bessette, Tracy (Fall)

title: MUPG 695 Graduate Jazz Improvisation Seminar
course_description: An intensive study of artistry in jazz improvisation. The improvisation ideas and approaches of various jazz artists will be studied through transcription, analysis and in performance. The latter will lay the foundation for students to develop their own artistic voices and musical ideas. Approximately one-third of the class will be spent performing, critiquing and mentoring the performances of class members.
instructor: Bolduc, Remi (Fall)

title: MUSP 123 Jazz Ear Training 1
course_description: Rhythmic, melodic and harmonic materials from the jazz idiom. Sight-singing, dictation and transcription with some classical materials.
instructor: Novak, Bohdanna; Dubovik, Lucas (Fall)

title: MUSP 124 Jazz Ear Training 2
course_description: Advanced jazz idioms.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUSP 140 Musicianship Training 1
course_description: Rhythm and metre basic subdivisions and conducting patterns; intervals, chords, and scale patterns; non-modulating tonal melodies with treble and bass clefs; harmonic progressions emphasizing two-part outer voice structures.
instructor: Mariner, Justin; Asly, Monica; Jonker, Alexandrea; De Castro, Margaret Emily; Elssner, Philipp (Fall)

title: MUSP 141 Musicianship Training 2
course_description: Rhythm and metre mixed divisions and syncopations; triadic and seventh chord voicings and disjunct pitch collections; chromatically embellished melodies adding alto clef; simple modulating harmonic progressions emphasizing two-part outer voice structures.
instructor: Asly, Monica; Mariner, Justin (Winter)

title: MUSP 240 Musicianship Training 3
course_description: Rhythm and metre mixed divisions and two-part work; additional chordal voicings and pitch collections; melodies modulating to closely-related keys adding tenor clef; harmonic progression including applied chords; two-part keyboard-style passages.
instructor: Asly, Monica; Issiyeva, Adalyat; Guzik, John (Fall)

title: MUSP 241 Musicianship Training 4
course_description: Changing metres; chord voicings and atonal pitch collections; modulating tonal melodies and score reading of transposing instruments; harmonic progression including chromatic chords; two-part passages.
instructor: Asly, Monica (Winter)

title: MUSP 324 Musicianship for Strings
course_description: Fundamental musicianship issues in the context of performance with an emphasis on intonation accuracy, rhythm, articulation, voice-leading and sound texture for strings.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUSP 330 Musicianship for Woodwinds
course_description: Fundamental musicianship issues in the context of performance with an emphasis on intonation accuracy, rhythm, articulation, voice-leading and sound texture for woodwinds.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUSP 335 Musicianship for Brass
course_description: Fundamental musicianship issues in the context of performance with an emphasis on intonation accuracy, rhythm, articulation, voice-leading and sound texture for brass.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUSP 346 Post-Tonal Musicianship
course_description: Extended tonal and post-tonal harmonic and contrapuntal structures, rhythmic practices of the 20th and 21st century, score reading.
instructor: Mariner, Justin (Fall)

title: MUSP 350 Musicianship for Pianists
course_description: Fundamental musicianship issues in the context of performance with an emphasis on sight-reading, practical score analysis and focused learning methods.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUSP 353 Musicianship for Voice
course_description: Fundamental musicianship issues in the context of performance with an emphasis on intonation accuracy, rhythm, voice-leading and sound texture.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUSP 354 Introduction to Improvisation and Ornamentation
course_description: Principles of improvisation and ornamentation for music before 1800, including harmonic progressions and voice-leading and contrapuntal patterns for instrumentalists and singers, along with examples of ornamented vocal and instrumental works from 17th and 18th century sources.
instructor: Schubert, Peter N (Winter)

title: MUSP 355 Musicianship for Percussion
course_description: Fundamental musicianship issues in the context of performance with an emphasis on polyrhythm.
instructor: Mativetsky, Shawn (Fall)

title: MUSP 361 Topics in Musicianship
course_description: Advanced ear training challenges in rhythm, pitch, harmony, form, or timbre.
instructor: Issiyeva, Adalyat (Fall)

title: MUSP 381 Singing Renaissance Notation
course_description: Choral sightsinging of mensural notation, with a focus on white notation c. 1420-1600. Development of basic fluency in the notation, interpretation of values in triple meter, addition of accidentals given the contrapuntal context as perceived aurally, Renaissance solmisation.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUSP 446 Advanced Musicianship 1
course_description: Advanced musicianship skills.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUSR 200 Audio Recording Essentials
course_description: A basic overview of audio recording. Topics include fundamentals of audio; a historical overview of recorded sound; analog and digital signal flow; listening environment design; listening and analysis; simple recording; connecting audio to a video camera; and audio on the web.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUSR 300D1 Introduction to Music Recording
course_description: The theory and practice of music recording including a study of recording environments, equipment and studio techniques. The analysis of music scores and recordings with respect to the requirements and possibilities of the recording studio. Studio work will include recording sessions, recording of live concerts, editing, mixing and music p.a.
instructor: St-Denis, André (Fall)

title: MUSR 300D2 Introduction to Music Recording
course_description: See MUSR 300D1 for description.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUSR 339 Introduction to Electroacoustics
course_description: Basic principles of operation and design of electroacoustical devices and systems; transducers and signal processing devices; magnetic tape sound recording - reproducing systems; disc recording, motion picture sound recording and reproducing systems; practical demonstration of some of these devices and associated measuring, testing and analyzing equipment and techniques.
instructor: Kelly, Jack (Winter)

title: MUSR 629D1 Technical Ear Training
course_description: This course will, through a sequence of specific auditory exercises, develop and improve students' aural sensitivity to small changes in sound quality. Students train to identify spectral variables in sound, develop stable reference of sound quality and learn about spectral characteristics of musical instruments.
instructor: Clemens-Seely, James (Fall)

title: MUSR 629D2 Technical Ear Training
course_description: See MUSR 629D1 for description.
instructor: Clemens-Seely, James (Winter)

title: MUSR 631D1 Advanced Technical Ear Training
course_description:
Identification and quantification of spatial parameters of sound image, nonlinear and transient distortion audibility, identification of coherent and incoherent noise, sound source identification in complex textures, sound enhancement and reconstruction. Instruction focused on acoustic and electroacoustic measurements is included throughout the year, as an exploration of the bridge between objective
measure and subjective impressions of various acoustic spaces and electronic equipment.
instructor: Kelly, Jack (Fall)

title: MUSR 631D2 Advanced Technical Ear Training
course_description: See MUSR 631D1 for description.
instructor: Kelly, Jack (Winter)

title: MUSR 667 Digital Studio Technology
course_description: Technical and operational characteristics of different digital recording systems currently employed by the recording industry.
instructor: Clemens-Seely, James; Kelly, Jack (Winter)

title: MUSR 668 Digital/Analog Audio Editing
course_description: Using analog and digital record/playback equipment, students learn, through practice, the art of replacing, patching, rebalancing, reconstructing, or generally speaking, improving recorded music through editing. Teaching will include cut and splice editing, disk-based editing, and editing by transfer and mixing.
instructor: De Francisco, Martha; Clemens-Seely, James; Kelly, Jack (Fall)

title: MUSR 669D2 Topics: Classical Music Recording
course_description: See MUSP 669D1 for description.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUSR 670D1 Recording Theory and Practice 1
course_description: Theoretical and practice study of recording equipment, procedures and techniques. Recording sessions and live stereo recording, using the recording studio, concert hall and portable equipment for on-location recording. Also included will be an introduction to the areas of radio drama, broadcast recording and radio commercials.
instructor: De Francisco, Martha; Woszczyk, Wieslaw (Fall)

title: MUSR 670D2 Recording Theory and Practice 1
course_description: See MUSR 670D1 for description.

title: MUSR 671D2 Recording Theory and Practice 2
course_description: See MUSR 671D1 for description.

title: MUSR 672D1 Analysis of Recordings
course_description: The analysis of recording engineering, production, performance, aesthetics and technical quality of selected recordings.

title: MUSR 672D2 Analysis of Recordings
course_description: See MUSR 672D1 for description.

title: MUSR 677D1 Audio for Video Post-Production
course_description: Theoretical study includes historical analysis of sound for image, audio post-production process for film and video, aesthetic and technical considerations in sound design, time code and synchronization, and final mix formats. Practical skills include field recording, sound library management, sound design, dialog, effects and music editing, and final mix process.
instructor: Mitchell, Geoffrey (Fall)

title: MUSR 677D2 Audio for Video Post-Production
course_description: See MUSR 677D1 for description.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUSR 678 Advanced Digital Editing and Post-Production
course_description: This course covers advanced concepts and techniques of audio post-production using digital workstations. Students practise the assembly of raw material into a complete final product through editing, signal processing, mixing, sound restoration and pre-mastering.
instructor: Clemens-Seely, James; Kelly, Jack (Winter)

title: MUSR 690 Special Field Research
course_description: Seminar focused on research preparation and methods, with course materials comprised of special field topics.
instructor: King, Richard; Woszczyk, Wieslaw; Kelly, Jack (Fall)

title: MUSR 691 Mastering and Restoration
course_description:
Advanced practices in mastering and remastering of recorded music. Emphasis on
digitizing and restoration (“clean-up") of ageing analog sources, print-through correction, and the assembling/mastering/finalizing of new recordings utilizing various techniques. Specific topics include archiving/preservation/metadata,
analog tape transfer including alignment/azimuth and record bias, 78rpm disc transfers including stylus choice/speed correction and playback curve selection. Instruction is included in equalization and dynamic range control processes as they relate specifically to the mastering process.
instructor: King, Richard (Fall)

title: MUSR 692 Music Production Workshop
course_description: The Seminar aims at giving Music Performance and Sound Recording students the tools to becoming better recording artists, performers and recording engineers in today’s music scene. It will help them acquire skills and abilities as well as develop an informed judgement about recorded music performances and the recorded sound.
instructor: De Francisco, Martha (Winter)

title: MUSR 695 Techniques of Immersive Sound
course_description:
Theory and practice of immersive sound. Exploration of advanced tools and techniques applied in three-dimensional recording and reproduction of music. Topics are chosen each year to reflect key areas of emerging knowledge
and applications in 3D audio. Learning is based on application of interdisciplinary components from music, acoustics, signal processing, auditory perception, virtual reality, and multimedia.
instructor: Woszczyk, Wieslaw (Fall)

title: MUTH 100 Music Theory Fundamentals
course_description: Basic training in music theory fundamentals. Topics include interval identification (both visual and aural), clef reading, chord recognition, melodic and rhythmic dictation, scales, and key signatures.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUTH 150 Theory and Analysis 1
course_description: Diatonic chords and harmonic progressions, focus on outer-voice framework, cadences, embellishments, building chordal fluency in common-practice tonality, applied chords.
instructor: Schubert, Peter N (Fall)

title: MUTH 151 Theory and Analysis 2
course_description: Sequences and modulation, chromatic vocabulary, analysis of simple theme types (sentence, period, hybrids) and fugal techniques.
instructor: Bakulina, Olga Ellen (Winter)

title: MUTH 202 Modal Counterpoint 1
course_description: Polyphonic techniques of the Renaissance period studied through analysis of works by Palestrina and others and through written exercises in two to three voices.
instructor: Neidhofer, Christoph (Fall)

title: MUTH 204 Tonal Counterpoint 1
course_description: The contrapuntal techniques of Baroque composers studied through detailed technical analysis of their works and through written exercises in strict style.
instructor: Renwick, James (Fall)

title: MUTH 250 Theory and Analysis 3
course_description: Compositional resources of late 18th and early 19th century music. Analysis of forms common to the period c. 1770 - 1840, including Classical sonata forms in several media.
instructor: Bakulina, Olga Ellen (Fall)

title: MUTH 251 Theory and Analysis 4
course_description: Expanded harmonic resources of the 19th century (e.g., advanced chromaticism including enharmonic reinterpretation and symmetrical division). Analysis of characteristic small and large forms. Writing and analytical skills with a goal toward perceiving how levels of musical structure interact.
instructor: Klorman, Edward; Mariner, Justin (Winter)

title: MUTH 302 Modal Counterpoint 2
course_description: Continuation of Modal Counterpoint I. Study of more advanced techniques through further analysis and written exercises in three or more voices.
instructor: Schubert, Peter N (Winter)

title: MUTH 304 Tonal Counterpoint 2
course_description: Further analysis and written exercises with special emphasis on fugal techniques in free style.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUTH 321 Topics in Tonal Analysis
course_description: Topics in advanced analysis of tonal music.
instructor: Bakulina, Olga Ellen (Fall)

title: MUTH 322 Topics in Post-Tonal Analysis
course_description: Topics in advanced analysis of post-tonal music.
instructor: Neidhofer, Christoph (Winter)

title: MUTH 350 Theory and Analysis 5
course_description: Exploration of 20th and 21st century organizations of pitch, rhythm, timbre etc. Written and analytical skills for the purpose of gaining insight into the compositional techniques and aesthetics of this repertoire.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUTH 426 Topics in Early Music Analysis
course_description: Music from before 1700 is analyzed using recently developed techniques as well as materials gathered from treatises contemporaneous with the music. The implications of analysis for performance are considered.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUTH 475 Special Project
course_description: For details contact the Department of Music Research.

title: MUTH 528 Schenkerian Theory and Analysis
course_description: Introduction to the principles and graphing techniques of Schenkerian theory, analysis of tonal works from 1700-1900, and study of prolongational techniques in relation to formal types.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUTH 529 Proseminar in Music Theory
course_description: An introduction to the discipline of music theory, including modern music theory and analysis.
instructor: Klorman, Edward (Fall)

title: MUTH 539 Topics in Advanced Writing Techniques
course_description: Advanced writing skills, including intensive four-part harmonization, advanced harmonic vocabulary and syntax, post-tonal counterpoint.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUTH 541 Topics in Popular Music Analysis
course_description: Different approaches to the analysis of popular music. Issues of transcription, notation, analytical pertinence, aesthetics, hermeneutics, and semiotics will be explored through transcription exercises, readings, and analysis of selected recordings.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUTH 602 Keyboard Modal Counterpoint
course_description: Advanced study of polyphonic techniques of the renaissance period through written exercises, in-depth written case study, and improvised practice at the keyboard.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUTH 604 Keyboard Tonal Counterpoint
course_description: Advanced study of polyphonic techniques of tonal music through written exercises, in-depth written case study, and improvised practice at the keyboard.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

course_description: Selected topics in the history of music theory from Greek antiquity to 1700 through readings of primary and secondary literature.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: MUTH 659 History of Music Theory 2
course_description: Selected topics in the history of music theory from 1700 to the present through readings of primary and secondary literature.
instructor: Hasegawa, Robert (Fall)

title: NEUR 301 TCP Neurology
faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
course_description: During this two-week course, students will develop the knowledge, skills, and attitudes required to diagnose and treat patients with common neurological problems. Students will also gain an understanding of the roles and responsibilities of the various health professionals involved in the treatment of neurological patients, and an appreciation for how these individuals work together as a team to provide effective and efficient care. In addition, students will have opportunities to discuss the various integral roles of a physician, as defined by the Royal College of Physicians and Surgeons of Canada’s CanMEDS framework.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: NEUR 310 Cellular Neurobiology
course_description: A survey of the functional organization of nerve cells, signalling in the nervous system, and principles of neural development. Topics include cell polarity, neurotransmitters, neurotrophins, receptors and second messengers, cell lineage, guidance of axon outgrowth, and nerve regeneration. Emphasis will be placed on analysis of neurons at the molecular level.
instructor: Cloutier, Jean-Francois; Ragsdale, David S; Kennedy, Timothy E; Fournier, Alyson Elise; Sossin, Wayne Steven; Ruthazer, Edward; Huang, Wei-Hsiang (Winter)

title: NEUR 502 Basic and Clinical Aspects of Neuroimmunology
faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
course_description:
The role of inflammation in physiological function of the nervous system, as well as in a broad range of neurological diseases where inflammation can act as a
contributing factor to the development of pathology or promote recovery, including fundamentals of neuroimmunology to molecular/cellular aspects of
neuroinflammation underlying the pathology seen in clinical conditions.
instructor: Zhang, Ji; Stratton, Jo Anne (Winter)

title: NEUR 503 Computational Neuroscience
faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
course_description:
A survey of computational methods commonly used to model brain function, including mathematical modeling to describe the relationship between neuronal activity and perception, action, and cognition. Mathematical basis for vision, motor
control and attention. Data relevant to brain processes and models explaining these data, using engineering, statistics and artificial intelligence.
instructor: Pack, Christopher; Baker, Curtis L; Misic, Bratislav; Cook, Erik; Chacron, Maurice; Peyrache, Adrien (Winter)

title: NEUR 507 Topics in Radionuclide Imaging
faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
course_description: The course deals with neuroreceptor and oncologic imaging and imaging of cerebral bloodflow and metabolism. The role of radiochemistry and physics will be demonstrated in the context of clinical and research applications. Understanding how radiochemistry and physics intermingle with the medical aspects of radiotracer development will result in a deeper insight into the complex pathways of tracer design and the methods necessary to properly interpret the data obtained.
instructor: Kostikov, Alexey; Rosa, Pedro; Soucy, Jean-Paul; Thiel, Alexander; Anazodo, Udunna; Rusjan, Pablo (Fall)

title: NEUR 550 Free Radical Biomedicine
course_description: An interdisciplinary course on the biochemistry and cellular/molecular biology of free radicals, transition metals, oxidative stress and antioxidants and their roles in health and disease.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: NEUR 560 History of Neuroscience
faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
course_description: A historical survey of neuroscience, from antiquity to the major discoveries of the 20th century. Conceptual and technical advances having led to our current understanding of brain function and dysfunctions will be discussed. Particular attention will be given to sensory systems and cognitive processes.
instructor: Mechawar, Naguib; Trenholm, Stuart (Winter)

title: NEUR 570 Human Brain Imaging
faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
course_description: Current methods that are used to investigate human brain structure and function will be discussed with an emphasis on Magnetic Resonance-based techniques including functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging, Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy, and Diffusion Tensor Imaging.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: NEUR 602 Current Topics in Neuroscience
faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
course_description: Current topics in Neuroscience.
instructor: Chen, Brian; Huang, Wei-Hsiang; Rao, Yong; Murai, Keith; Stellwagen, David; Ernst, Carl; Brandon, Mark; Williams, Sylvain; Peyrache, Adrien; Avoli, Massimo; Gotman, Jean; Lévesque, Maxime; Frauscher, Birgit; Storch, Kai-Florian; Boivin, Diane B; Chai, Xiaoqian; Chakravarty, Megha; Iturria Medina, Yasser (Fall)

title: NEUR 605 Neuroscience Seminar 4
faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
course_description: This course focuses on neuronal development and maturation from a molecular aspect. We introduce various model organisms and systems that are used to study molecular aspects of development, explore their particular advantages and explore the cellular and molecular events that contribute to the development of the nervous system.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: NEUR 606 Methods in Neuroimaging
faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
course_description: An introduction to the design and analysis of neuroimaging experiments in humans.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: NEUR 608 Neuroimaging Data Science
course_description: Cutting-edge analytics as applied to complex and multimodal neuroimaging datasets. Topics include statistics, associative techniques, graph theoretical analysis, causal models, nonparametric inference, and meta-analytical synthesis.
instructor: Bernhardt, Boris; Misic, Bratislav (Fall)

title: NEUR 610 Functional Neuroanatomy
faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
course_description: This course will examine current topics in the functional anatomy of the human brain. The emphasis will be on how anatomical organization determines function. The course will comprise classroom sessions and dissection of human brains.
instructor: Ragsdale, David S; Spreng, Robert Nathan (Winter)

title: NEUR 631 Principles of Neuroscience 2
faculty: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences
course_description: An overview of the structure, function and interaction of neuronal systems of vertebrates. Topics include basic neuroanatomy, coding and processing of sensory information (somatic sensory, visual and auditory systems), control of posture and voluntary movement, learning and memory, processing of language and speech, cerebral blood flow, the neuroendocrine system and neuroimmunology.
instructor: Ragsdale, David S; Ernst, Carl; Sadikot, Abbas; Guitton, Daniel E; Trenholm, Stuart; Cléry, Justine (Winter)

title: NEUR 710 Connectional Research: Lab-to-World Impact
course_description: Conceptual and hands-on training in connectional research, with an emphasis on lab-to-world impact and academic entrepreneurship. Concepts in ideation, idea refinement and definition, stakeholder identification, market analysis and ethnographic studies, and structure of impactful proposals.
instructor: Farivar-Mohseni, Reza (Winter)

title: NRSC 221 Environment and Health
course_description: Introduction to physical and social environments as factors contributing to the production of human health, with emphasis on the physical properties of the atmospheric environment as they interact with diverse human populations in urban settings.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: NRSC 333 Pollution and Bioremediation
course_description: The environmental contaminants which cause pollution; sources, amounts and transport of pollutants in water, air and soil; waste management.
instructor: Whyte, Lyle; Head, Jessica (Fall)

title: NRSC 405 Natural History of East Africa
course_description:
Integrated study of African landforms, geologic history, climate, environments, biota, water resources and human influences, fostering a thorough
understanding of the East African landscape and its inhabitants. Lectures, discussions on selected topics, use of museum resources and field studies will
develop powers of observation, identification and enquiry.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: NRSC 510 Agricultural Micrometeorology
course_description: Interaction between plant communities and the atmosphere. The physical processes governing the transfer of heat, mass and momentum as they relate to research and production in agricultural and environmental systems. Experimental techniques for measuring fluxes of heat, water-vapour, CO2 and natural and man-made pollutants.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: NRSC 610 Advanced Environmental Assessment
course_description: A detailed account of the evolution of environmental assessment related concepts, processes, procedures and best practices in Canada and internationally.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: NRSC 612 Environmental Assessment and Sustainable Development
course_description: A detailed consideration of environmental assessment as a tool for sustainable development.
instructor: Kosoy, Nicolas (Winter)

title: NRSC 614 Special Topics 7
course_description: Students pursue topics not otherwise available in formal courses, under staff supervision.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: NRSC 616 Environmental Assessment Project Paper
course_description: Written report describing the approach to and resolution of the environmental assessment issue addressed during the internship in Environmental Assessment.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: NRSC 620 Into the Ecozoic
course_description: An examination of how the "Ecozoic" framing can be used as an alternative to the current discourse on sustainability; emphasis on the evolution of major thought systems of Western culture such as private property, the nation state, money and human rights and their role in generating the rapidly accelerating decline in life's prospects. Identification and exploration of efforts currently under the re-establish a flourishing earth; areas considered include agroecology, all species food security, family planning, forest management and others.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: NRSC 621 Restoring a Flourishing Earth
course_description:
Application of the “Ecozoic” framing to real-world problems. Delivered as a field course that provides hands-on experience related to a particular problem due
to climate change and other human activities. Activities are designed in consultation with university instructors, government, non-governmental organizations, communities of practice and other key stakeholders.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: NRSC 622D1 Seminar for the Ecozoic
course_description: Student-led seminar provides opportunity to develop skills in course development and to apply theory and practical experience to examination of one or more thought systems such as economics and finance; law and governance, and ethics and ontology and how the thought system should be rethought in light of the Ecozoic.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

title: NSCI 200 Introduction to Neuroscience 1
course_description: An introduction to how nerve cells generate action potentials, communicate with one another at synapses, develop synaptic connections, early brain development, and the construction of specific neural circuits.

course_description: An introduction to how the nervous system acquires and integrates information and uses it to produce behaviour.
instructor: There are no professors associated with this course for the 2023-2024 academic year.

course_description: An introduction to ethical issues arising from basic and clinical neuroscience. Overview of therapeutic, diagnostic, and research interventions in mental and neurological disorders, and their implications on society.
instructor: Yazdani, Armin (Winter)
